name: EU Right to be Forgotten
description: The EU Right to be Forgotten, drafted in 2012 and officially established in May 2014, is an EU bill that allows any private citizen to request their online information be removed.

name: Snowden leaks
description: Edward Snowden leaked classified documents revealing how the NSA had been spying on U.S. and foreign citizens. This date is when the first media reporting based on leaked information was published.

name: General Data Protection Regulation
description: The GDPR is adopted by the European Parliament; regulation went into force a month later. GDPR imposes strict requirements for how companies handle the personal data of EU citizens.

name: Yahoo data breach
description: Yahoo announced that the account information of at least 500 million users was stolen by hackers two years prior.'

name: Republican National Committee (Deep Root Analytics) leak
description: Data on almost 200 million U.S. citizens was inadvertently exposed by a firm working with the RNC.

name: Equifax data breach
description: Credit reporting agency Equifax announced the data breach in September 2017, eventually reporting that 147 million consumers were affected (about 56% of Americans).

name: Facebook/Cambridge Analytica data scandal
description: Date the Facebook-Cambridge Analytica scandal, in which data on 87 million Facebook profiles were harvested by the Cambridge Analytica firm, was disclosed. Facebook stock fell by about 24%.

name: Mark Zuckerberg's testimony to Congress
description: Zuckerberg answered questions from the Senate commerce and judiciary committees on privacy and regulations and Cambridge Analytica.

name: California Consumer Privacy Act
description: The CCPA was passed by the state legislature and signed by Gov. Brown on June 28 2018; it became effective on January 1 2020.

name: COVID-19 pandemic
description: The COVID-19 pandemic brought much more of our social lives online. This is the date that it was declared a pandemic by WHO.
